bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, June 3, 1879

div1.p: Reed writes that he appreciates Emilie Lawrence Reed's sacrifices. His son will be 18 months old on June 4, 1879. He sends his love and misses them.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, June 3, 1879
div1.p:
It is not long
before the orderly will call for the mail,
so that I must write only a few
words to my darling- I wrote you
from San Carlos Agency that we
would not get back to Apache before
to-morrow, but by making long marches,
we succeeded in reaching here to-day-
I am, of course, very dirty & somewhat
tired, but feel much better from
my trip- I have just read your
darling letter dated Norfolk, April
12th- Am so happy to know that my
precious Emilie is enjoying herself-
I know she thinks of her poor mantee
when she is eating all the good
things; but don't let that detract from
the enjoyment, my own little darling, for
you deserve & richly merit every
comfort & luxury for your noble
selfsacrificing conduct in Arizona,
which husband has not forgotten, but
has laid up to his precious darling's
credit- Bless her heart; she's the swee-
test woman alive & husband well
knows it! I am not surprised that
our darling little Laurie is considered
bright & pretty- Papa always said
so, & he knew what he was talking
about- Kiss him a hundred times
for papa & talk to him, my darling wife,
about papa every day, so that he
won't forget me! Tomorrow he will
be 18 months old- God bless & keep
him safe the coming 18 months & many
more is my prayer every day!

Husband has not the time to write
more- Be a darling, sweet, cheerful
happy little Emilie, wifie- Eat all
you can- grow “fat & kick.”- Think of
husband always- Kiss “didnt didn't
day” a hundred times- love to all & accept
Oceans of love from your own darling
& affectionate husband.
